snippet: Malcolm Gladwell sets out to explore two ideas in his new book: that there is greatness and beauty in David-Goliath fights; and that “we consistently get these kinds of conflicts wrong.”
abstract: Janet Maslin reviews book David and Goliath: Underdogs, Misfits, and the Art of Battling Giants by Malcolm Gladwell.
lead_paragraph: Malcolm Gladwell sets out to explore two ideas in his new book: that there is greatness and beauty in David-Goliath fights; and that “we consistently get these kinds of conflicts wrong.”

headline.seo: In ‘David and Goliath,’ Gladwell Explores Two Ideas
headline.main: Finding Talking Points Among the Underdogs
headline.print_headline: Finding Talking Points Among the Underdogs
